entry.title: Transition to post-quantum
entry.summary: In an email conversation on February 15, 2018, Natanael expressed concerns about the security implications of allowing expiration for a certain system. Natanael argued that allowing expiration would retain insecurity, while not allowing it would make the system a trivial denial-of-service (DoS) target. However, the exact details regarding the system in question and the context of the conversation are not provided.The communication took place over email, as evidenced by the timestamp and formatting of the message. It appears that some form of editing or correction was made to a previous quote, based on the first line of the email. Additionally, an HTML attachment was included in the email, but no information is given about its contents or relevance to the conversation.Overall, the email exchange between Natanael and the other party involves a discussion about the potential security risks associated with allowing expiration for a particular system. Natanael argues that there are drawbacks to both allowing and not allowing expiration, and it is unclear what specific course of action was ultimately taken.
